businessSummary.oneLiner: World's largest EV maker pivoting into a 'Physical AI Platform' spanning robotaxis, humanoid robots, and energy storage
businessSummary.description: Tesla is rapidly transforming from an EV maker into an integrated AI, robotics, and energy platform. FY2025 revenue was $94.8B, marking the first-ever annual revenue decline (-2.9%), with net income dropping 46.5%. The first Cybercab production unit rolled off Giga Texas on 2/17, making the robotaxi era a reality. FSD cumulative miles surpassed 8.2 billion, and the Netherlands' RDW approved FSD Supervised for the EU. Baird upgraded to Outperform with a $548 target. Meanwhile, China delivery times collapsed to 1-3 weeks as Tesla extended its financing promo through Q1, and the company counter-sued California's DMV over FSD false advertising claims.
howTheyMakeMoney: Vehicle sales: ~73% of revenue ($69.5B). Model 3/Y core, Model S/X discontinued Q2 2026
Energy: ~14% of revenue ($12.8B, +27% YoY). Megapack utility-scale storage
Services/Other: ~13% of revenue ($12.5B). Supercharger network, insurance, maintenance
FSD subscription: $99/mo autonomous driving software (subscription-only since Feb 2026)
keyProducts: Optimus (humanoid robot, Fremont factory conversion underway)
Megapack (utility-scale energy storage, Megapack 3 & Mega Block launching 2026)

keyMetrics.name: P/E (TTM)
keyMetrics.interpretation: Extremely high valuation based on EPS $1.09. Robotaxi/AI premium priced in

keyMetrics.name: Forward P/E
keyMetrics.interpretation: Based on FY2026 EPS $2.09 estimate. Still at a significant premium

keyMetrics.name: Revenue Growth
keyMetrics.interpretation: First-ever annual revenue decline. FY2026 recovery to +11.3% expected

keyMetrics.name: Operating Margin
keyMetrics.interpretation: Sharply lower vs FY2024. Price cuts and competition weighing

keyMetrics.name: ROE
keyMetrics.interpretation: Sharp decline from FY2024. Profitability under pressure

growthDrivers.title: Cybercab Production Begins ‚Äî Robotaxi Era Arrives
growthDrivers.description: First steering-wheel-free Cybercab unit rolled off Giga Texas on 2/17. Priced at $30,000, mass production starts April. Plans to expand robotaxi service to 9 US cities in H1.

growthDrivers.title: Baird Upgrades to Outperform ‚Äî $548 Price Target
growthDrivers.description: Baird upgraded Tesla to Outperform with a $548 target, citing Musk's growth-linked compensation milestones and long-term Cybercab/FSD vision.

growthDrivers.title: FSD 8.2B Miles + Subscription Pivot + First EU Approval
growthDrivers.description: FSD Supervised crossed 8.2B cumulative miles. Transitioned to $99/mo subscription-only model. Netherlands' RDW granted first EU approval.

growthDrivers.title: Energy Business Expansion ‚Äî Megapack 3 & Mega Block in 2026
growthDrivers.description: Energy revenue $12.8B (+27% YoY). Higher-margin Megapack 3 and Mega Block products launching in 2026, driving profitability improvement.

competitiveAdvantage.summary: US EV market share 50%+ (#1), overtaken globally by BYD. Vertical integration across software, manufacturing, and energy, plus 8.2B autonomous driving miles as core moat.

moats.description: FSD Supervised 8.2B miles. Overwhelmingly larger training dataset vs competitors.
In-house battery (4680), custom chips (HW4), software (FSD), charging infrastructure (Supercharger).
NACS is the North American EV charging standard. GM, Ford, Rivian all depend on Tesla's Supercharger network.

competitors.name: BYD
competitors.detail: 2025 global EV sales #1 (2.26M units, +28%). Tariffs limit US entry

competitors.name: Rivian (RIVN)
competitors.detail: R2 SUV ($45,000) launching 2026, directly competing with Model Y

competitors.name: GM
competitors.detail: US EV market share ~13%, growing rapidly

recentNews.headline: Baird Upgrades Tesla to Outperform ‚Äî $548 Price Target
recentNews.significance: Cites growth milestone-linked compensation and long-term Cybercab/FSD vision. Improving Wall Street sentiment.

recentNews.headline: China Delivery Times Collapse to 1-3 Weeks ‚Äî Financing Promo Extended Through Q1
recentNews.significance: Demand weakness signal in China. Repeated promo deadline extensions diminish urgency effect.

recentNews.headline: Tesla Counter-Sues California DMV Over Autopilot False Advertising Claims
recentNews.significance: Fighting back against FSD false advertising allegations. Regulatory risk and legal uncertainty persist.

recentNews.headline: Board Member Kathleen Wilson-Thompson Sells 25,731 Shares ($10.7M)
recentNews.significance: Pre-planned option exercise and sale at $412-$419 range. Limited market impact but insider selling continues.

recentNews.headline: Trefis: Energy Revenue Acceleration + Megapack 3/Mega Block as Next Catalysts
recentNews.significance: Energy segment FY2026 revenue growth 26.6%+ acceleration expected. High-margin new products to drive profitability.

analystOpinions.notableComment: Baird Outperform upgrade ($548), Wedbush $600 bull case, GLJ $25 bear case. Consensus raised to $408. Trefis highlights energy growth catalyst.

risks.title: Musk Epstein Subpoena Risk ‚Äî Political Uncertainty
risks.description: Hillary Clinton demanded Musk subpoena in Congress. Epstein files reportedly contain Musk-related records. CEO risk expanding.

risks.title: China Demand Weakness ‚Äî 1-3 Week Delivery, Repeated Promo Extensions
risks.description: China delivery times shrunk to 1-3 weeks signaling weak demand. 7-year financing promo extended for the third time.

risks.title: European Sales Down 14 Consecutive Months
risks.description: January EU registrations -17% YoY. Musk's political controversies damaging brand image.

risks.title: P/E 369x ‚Äî Extreme Valuation
risks.description: TTM P/E 369, Forward P/E 193. Significant downside risk without profitability recovery.

risks.title: California DMV Counter-Suit + Autopilot Litigation
risks.description: DMV counter-suit and $243M verdict upheld. Legal uncertainty continues.

buyReasons.title: Baird Outperform Upgrade ‚Äî $548 Target
buyReasons.rationale: New bull analyst added. Consensus raised to $408. Growing institutional confidence in long-term vision.

buyReasons.title: Cybercab April Mass Production ‚Äî Robotaxi Revenue Materializing
buyReasons.rationale: First unit produced 2/17 at $30,000 price point. Success would dramatically improve per-vehicle profitability.

buyReasons.title: Energy Business +27% Growth + Megapack 3 Launch
buyReasons.rationale: Megapack revenue $12.8B. High-margin Megapack 3 and Mega Block launching 2026 to improve profitability.

buyReasons.title: Net Cash $29.3B ‚Äî Financial Safety Net
buyReasons.rationale: Debt/equity 0.18, strong net cash position. Ample funding for Cybercab and Optimus investment.

overallOpinion: Tesla closed at $402.51, still below the 50-day SMA ($435). China demand weakness (1-3 week delivery) and repeated promo extensions are the top near-term concerns.
Baird's Outperform upgrade ($548) is a positive signal, but at P/E 369x, political risks (Epstein subpoena) and macro headwinds continue to pressure shares.
Long-term drivers remain intact ‚Äî Cybercab April production, Megapack 3 launch, FSD EU approval ‚Äî but near-term China and Europe demand weakness pose the biggest risks.

sources.name: Electrek
sources.description: China delivery time collapse and financing extension
